title: Hirose UK
author: Hirose UK
content: I will share a little of my experience when I invite some friends who like to bet at local bookies.A few months ago about 4 of my friends came to my local town house to bet on a football game and after a while they were arrested by law enforcement in my country because I live in a country where gambling is strictly prohibited and there are laws in it. They were all jailed for several days and had to pay fines to be released from prosecution.Here I feel sorry for them if they have to deal with the law again so I teach and give them an understanding of crypto casino, after understanding I suggest using crypto casino which I believe they can use as well so they can bet on every sporting event freely and without having to afraid to face the law again.And what concerns me is that one of them actually becomes a gambling addict in a crypto casino. It was a pity that he had lost his senses and forgot about his responsibilities as the head of the family to the point where he was more concerned with money at stake.From that incident I felt very guilty for inviting him to bet at a crypto casino until he became an addict.I want to ask for advice and input from members here, what should I do to deal with this friend of mine and how should I react to it because he became a crazy gambler because of my invitation.

comments.body: Quote from: Hirose UK on April 12, 2023, 08:34:57 AMI want to ask for advice and input from members here, what should I do to deal with this friend of mine and how should I react to it because he became a crazy gambler because of my invitation.Just tell him your mind and tell him to quit gambling. Let him know that addcits are not adviced to reduce the amount of money they are gambling with, that addicts should stop gambling and go for self exclusion. You know more than him about gambling is the truth, you can get some news about what ended the life of some addicts and how chasing money with gambling will only lead to depression, thievery or illegal acts. If trustworthy, tell him how you trust him, but that you are just saying how gambling addiction is not good at all.

comments.body: Don't feel guilty about it if it is really not your intention to make him addictive to it, you just invite him to play to entertain and no one wanted that to happen. As a friend what you can do is to talk him and his family and probably knock the sense out of him. Actually that's up into him if he really wanted to change for the sake of his family because after all even if you do all of the possible things to help him and he can't help himself or trying to help himself, you are just wasting time.

comments.author: tusandii
comments.body: If I understand from what you have said it does not seem entirely your fault.You are just a friend of theirs and feel sorry if they have to deal with the law just because of gambling until you decide to introduce crypto casinos to them to be safer and in the future not to be in trouble with the law again.It is better to suggest to your friend who is already addicted to think more clearly and limit his gambling so that there is no destruction in his family.It would be a shame if the unity and harmony of the family were destroyed just because of gambling addiction.Give your friend motivation, friend and advise slowly so he can think that his actions are a big mistake, don't forget to keep an eye on him so he doesn't fall deeper into gambling.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: Hirose UK on April 12, 2023, 08:34:57 AM[....]I want to ask for advice and input from members here, what should I do to deal with this friend of mine and how should I react to it because he became a crazy gambler because of my invitation.Would you blame yourself if you introduced a new bar to a casual drinker and that person frequently visited the place where he eventually became a real alcoholic? If your answer to the question is NO then I think you shouldn't put the burden on yourself when that friend of yours became a gambling addict. The only instance that I think you should also take the blame is if you forced him or hyped him too much without giving him any warning.

It was a pity that he had lost his senses and forgot about his responsibilities as the head of the family to the point where he was more concerned with money at stake.From that incident I felt very guilty for inviting him to bet at a crypto casino until he became an addict.I want to ask for advice and input from members here, what should I do to deal with this friend of mine and how should I react to it because he became a crazy gambler because of my invitation.This should be a lesson. Not because you do want to help, you'd already provide the help; think of the consequences. It is never advisable to support an individual in gambling because of the risks involved. But no matter what, and if the cited situation is true, be a friend to him. Help him morally to regain atleast his mental state. Also, try to accompany him with other activity not involving risk and money such as sports and the likes to somehow calibrate his drive to gamble. Also, do not blame yourself for everything because that's his decision in the first place. It is solely dependent with the gambler on how would he end up after playing; broke, victorious, or just fine.Â  Lastly, seek for professional help becaause addiction is not something to be cured in an instant and with ease.

comments.author: virasisog
comments.body: That is already his personal choice. If he has been gambling for a long time, he should know that crypto casino has the same risks as physical casinos. If you have warned or reminded him about responsible gambling then you shouldn't feel guilty. You can continuously remind him about controlling his compulsive gambling since you're friends but his choices and decisions will rely on the risks that he could take. This is actually the consequence of introducing gambling to people who are close to us because when they fall for gambling addiction, you might feel guilty.

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: That's why I never invite people closest to me to get to know crypto casinos for fear that this will happen, but if you have already invited your friends and are now addicts it's not entirely your fault because basically you just introduce them to him, the rest he controls it, make this experience so you don't make this mistake again in the future because we don't know someone's character in gambling.If your friend is more concerned with the money that has been risked and the money that has been lost than his family, it is clear that he has become a heavy addict, I can't help much, it's just that a person like this usually stops on his own when he loses everything, but if you feel sorry for him and want to stop it before he loses everything better find someone close who can advise him to stop for example the people he loves the most in his life like his parents or whoever it is. if it doesn't work, there are also many ways on the internet that you might try or suggestions from other friends in this thread

comments.author: wildan88
comments.body: Local bookmakers are quite capable of offering cryptos, as little regulation is needed for this to succeed. You just don't know exactly where your money is with Crypto, that's a disadvantage. But nowadays there are also large bookmakers who also offer crypto extra to be able to play. But is it wise to gamble with a crypto bookmaker that does not have a license and also has no company information on the site at all? Crypto gambling is becoming increasingly popular, that is one thing that is certain. Many gamblers love the anonymity of course.
